intro: Cussonia barteri, commonly known as the African arrowroot or red arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its smooth, reddish-barked trunk and large, palmate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, followed by dark blue, fleshy berries. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Cussonia barteri is valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in some African cultures.
